params._hashtags: The hashtags used for that piece of content

checkExistingSubscription(bytes32).return: bool If you are subscribed to that hashtag or not

getContentById(uint256).return: Returns the id, author, date, content and hashtags for that piece of content

params._amount: The quantity of contents to get for instance, 50 pieces of content for that hashtag
params._hashtag: The hashtag from which get content

getContentIdsByHashtag(bytes32,uint256).return: uint256[] Returns the ids of the contents so that you can get each piece independently with a new request since you can't return arrays of strings

getFollowedHashtags().return: bytes32[] The hashtags followed by this user

params._amount: How many top hashtags to get in order, for instance the top 20 hashtags

getTopHashtags(uint256).return: bytes32[] Returns the names of the hashtags

sortHashtagsByScore().return: bytes32[] Returns the sorted array of hashtags

addContent(string,bytes32[]).notice: To add new content to the social media dApp. If no hashtags are sent, the content is added to the #general hashtag list.

checkExistingSubscription(bytes32).notice: To check if the use is already subscribed to a hashtag

getContentById(uint256).notice: Returns the data for a particular content id

getContentIdsByHashtag(bytes32,uint256).notice: To get the contents for a particular hashtag. It returns the ids because we can't return arrays of strings and we can't return structs so the user has to manually make a new request for each piece of content using the function below.

getFollowedHashtags().notice: To get the followed hashtag names for this msg.sender

sortHashtagsByScore().notice: Sorts the hashtags given their hashtag score

subscribeToHashtag(bytes32).notice: To subscribe to a hashtag if you didn't do so already

unsubscribeToHashtag(bytes32).notice: To unsubscribe to a hashtag if you are subscribed otherwise it won't do nothing
